text: Prof. Wirth of ETH built his own computer, the Lilith machine, that had its own operating system, and was very complete and usable. It was amazingly compact, all written in Oberon, which was a successor to Modula-2 (which was the 10 year successor to Pascal). Not enough people appreciated how clever that was to make a whole computer and OS together.
